intro: Triphasia javanica, commonly known as the Javan triphasia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are small, capsule-like structures. Triphasia javanica is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
